titleStmt.title: A discourse of the rise & power of parliaments, of law's, of courts of judicature, of liberty, property, and religion, of the interest of England in reference to the desines of France, of taxes and of trade in a letter from a gentleman in the country to a member in Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Sheridan, Thomas, 1646-ca. 1688.

titleStmt.title: A discourse of the rise & power of parliaments, of law's, of courts of judicature, of liberty, property, and religion, of the interest of England in reference to the desines of France, of taxes and of trade in a letter from a gentleman in the country to a member in Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Sheridan, Thomas, 1646-ca. 1688.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Thomas Sheridan. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.).
Pages 208 and 218 tightly bound in filmed copy. Pages 200-25 photographed from Cambridge University copy and inserted at end.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
